title: Who sang most of the Beatles No. 1 hits? - Quora

response.answer_text: Paul sang most of the number one hits. below is the list of the Beatles #1’s. Tracklisting:Love Me Do, Paul was the main writer but both sang itFrom Me To You, Both wrote and sang itShe Loves You, Both wrote and sang itI Want To Hold Your Hand, Both wrote and sang itCan't Buy Me Love, Both wrote and sang itA Hard Day's Night, Lennon was the main writer but both sang it I Feel Fine, John was the main writer and sang itEight Days A Week, Paul was the main writer but both sang itTicket To Ride, John was the main writer and sang itHelp!, John was the main writer and sang itYesterday, Paul was the writer and singerDay Tripper, John was the main writer and both sang itWe Can Work It Out, Paul was the main writer and singerPaperback Writer, Paul was the main writer and singerYellow Submarine, Paul wrote it but Ringo sang itEleanor Rigby, Paul was the main writer and singerPenny Lane, Paul was the main writer and singerAll You Need Is Love, John was the main writer and singerHello, Goodbye, Paul was the main writer and singerLady Madonna, Paul was the main writer and singerHey Jude, Paul was the main writer and singerGet Back, Paul was the main writer and singerThe Ballad Of John And Yoko, John was the main writer and singerSomething, George was the writer and singerCome Together, John was the main writer and singerLet It Be, Paul was the main writer and singerThe Long And Winding Road, Paul was the main writer and singer Many of the early hits both wrote and sang on but later on each was writing more on their own and Paul wrote and sang more of their hits. This should come as no surprise because in several interviews where songwriting was discussed John always said that Paul wrote more commercial songs than he did.

My guess would be John. No doubt Paul had some big hits as well. I did a list one time of all my favorite Beatle songs. I looked them up one by one to see who wrote what. John songs slightly outweighed Pauls. Typically who ever wrote the song was the lead singer on the song. What was cool too is how they did a dual lead vocal on some songs, great blend and talent the two of them. It’s interesting because they both have dynamics different from each other. John to me is a little more straight forward meat and potatoes harder hitting rock and roll. Not saying he didn’t have some moments with slower and softer songs. To put it bluntly John had more balls to his songs overall. I find his songs more simple too. “Come Together”, “I want you (She’s so heavy)” and “Revolution” come to mind. That being said Paul is a musician’s musician and the better singer of the two. Paul has a bigger range and is a more refined vocalist. It’s well documented that both John and Paul played multiple instruments, but to me it’s clear Paul could of been and on some of the songs was a one man band. Check out “Back in the U.S.S.R.”, I believe that’s Paul on the drums. Paul is insanely talented as an artist as well. Although he might of had less hits, Pauls hits were monsters. I think they may of stayed on the charts longer. Songs like “Yesterday”, “Hey Jude” and “Let it Be”. Those were anthems, universal songs that stood out maybe more than the others. I would also say Paul has some rockers too “Helter Skelter” he put it down. I also think Pauls writing style is a bit more complex than Johns. It’s clear he’s a smart and deep individual.
